page.lettertext:
Belgia 1589 24 Novem
b
To M
r
Secretary
It may please yo
r
H. The bearer hereof
Mons
r
Lect
is
deputed by the city of
Geneva
to sollicit hir
Ma
ty
& other
princes in
e behalf of their afflicted state wh
r
of hee himself
and his letters will give ample informa
o
n Hee was forced
to come furth into these quarters, by contrarety of winde &
wether, & having l
re
s to
e
ge
nal
l States
of these Provinces
hath bin instant w
th
th
e
& obteyned a very favourable
aunswere. For they have
mised to recommend his cause
effectuallie to
e Provinces & Townes, & to bee carefull in
calling upon them for a speedy retourne of their determination
& yf they cannot be induced to yeeld to some relief
by waie of publick ceasement & contribution: they have
put him in hope
e same order wilbe taken for the g
nal
l
collecting of ev
r
y patient mans benevolence, wh
r
in they give
their worde to to doe their uttermost endevour w
ch
I thinke
they will
fourme in good sort for their owne reputation
& to remove
e opinion conceaved of their want of zeale
& good affection to
e cause of religion, upon this their
willing resolution, for w
ch
he hath staied heer but 4 daies
hee hath left a sufficient
son behinde to negotiate in
his absence, w
ch
is also don w
th
their advise, for
e
winning of time. w
ch
I thought expedient to im
te
w
th
yo
r
H.
& to take th
r
w
th
all my humble leave.
Hagh the 24 No
v
89
